title: Simplified Version
content: This simplified version of the 30 Articles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights has been created especially for young people.

rights.title: 1. We Are All Born Free & Equal.
rights.content: We are all born free. We all have our own thoughts and ideas. We should all be treated in the same way.

rights.title: 2. Don’t Discriminate.
rights.content: These rights belong to everybody, whatever our differences.

rights.title: 3. The Right to Life.
rights.content: We all have the right to life, and to live in freedom and safety.

rights.title: 4. No Slavery.
rights.content: Nobody has any right to make us a slave. We cannot make anyone our slave.

rights.title: 5. No Torture.
rights.content: Nobody has any right to hurt us or to torture us.

rights.title: 6. You Have Rights No Matter Where You Go.
rights.content: I am a person just like you!

rights.title: 7. We’re All Equal Before the Law.
rights.content: The law is the same for everyone. It must treat us all fairly.

rights.title: 8. Your Human Rights Are Protected by Law.
rights.content: We can all ask for the law to help us when we are not treated fairly.

rights.title: 9. No Unfair Detainment.
rights.content: Nobody has the right to put us in prison without good reason and keep us there, or to send us away from our country.

rights.title: 10. The Right to Trial.
rights.content: If we are put on trial this should be in public. The people who try us should not let anyone tell them what to do.

rights.title: 11. We’re Always Innocent Till Proven Guilty.
rights.content: Nobody should be blamed for doing something until it is proven. When people say we did a bad thing we have the right to show it is not true.

rights.title: 12. The Right to Privacy.
rights.content: Nobody should try to harm our good name. Nobody has the right to come into our home, open our letters, or bother us or our family without a good reason.

rights.title: 13. Freedom to Move.
rights.content: We all have the right to go where we want in our own country and to travel as we wish.

rights.title: 14. The Right to Seek a Safe Place to Live.
rights.content: If we are frightened of being badly treated in our own country, we all have the right to run away to another country to be safe.

rights.title: 15. Right to a Nationality.
rights.content: We all have the right to belong to a country.

rights.title: 16. Marriage and Family.
rights.content: Every grown-up has the right to marry and have a family if they want to. Men and women have the same rights when they are married, and when they are separated.

rights.title: 17. The Right to Your Own Things.
rights.content: Everyone has the right to own things or share them. Nobody should take our things from us without a good reason.

rights.title: 18. Freedom of Thought.
rights.content: We all have the right to believe in what we want to believe, to have a religion, or to change it if we want.

rights.title: 19. Freedom of Expression.
rights.content: We all have the right to make up our own minds, to think what we like, to say what we think, and to share our ideas with other people.

rights.title: 20. The Right to Public Assembly.
rights.content: We all have the right to meet our friends and to work together in peace to defend our rights. Nobody can make us join a group if we don’t want to.

rights.title: 21. The Right to Democracy.
rights.content: We all have the right to take part in the government of our country. Every grown-up should be allowed to choose their own leaders.

rights.title: 22. Social Security.
rights.content: We all have the right to affordable housing, medicine, education, and childcare, enough money to live on and medical help if we are ill or old.

rights.title: 23. Workers’ Rights.
rights.content: Every grown-up has the right to do a job, to a fair wage for their work, and to join a trade union.

rights.title: 24. The Right to Play.
rights.content: We all have the right to rest from work and to relax.

rights.title: 25. Food and Shelter for All.
rights.content: We all have the right to a good life. Mothers and children, people who are old, unemployed or disabled, and all people have the right to be cared for.

rights.title: 26. The Right to Education.
rights.content: Education is a right. Primary school should be free. We should learn about the United Nations and how to get on with others. Our parents can choose what we learn.

rights.title: 27. Copyright.
rights.content: Copyright is a special law that protects one’s own artistic creations and writings; others cannot make copies without permission. We all have the right to our own way of life and to enjoy the good things that art, science and learning bring.

rights.title: 28. A Fair and Free World.
rights.content: There must be proper order so we can all enjoy rights and freedoms in our own country and all over the world.

rights.title: 29. Responsibility.
rights.content: We have a duty to other people, and we should protect their rights and freedoms.

rights.title: 30. No One Can Take Away Your Human Rights.
